alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 8:53AM MDT until April 17 at 4:54PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albuquerque NM has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Mexico... Jemez River Above Jemez Pueblo affecting Sandoval County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. Expect overbank flooding within 24 hours. Further rises will impact bridges and low lying roads. This water is extremely cold. Exercise caution near the river. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Jemez River above Jemez Pueblo. * WHEN...Until Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Significant overbank flows are occurring from above Jemez Springs down through the Jemez Pueblo. Further rises will result in bridges becoming unsafe to cross in and around Jemez Springs. At 10.0 feet, Widespread overbank flooding is occurring. Bridges in and around Jemez Springs are either impassable or unsafe to cross due to the high water and debris caught up in the fast flow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 7.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 9.2 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 05/13/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 900 PM MDT.
